1: <sup>1</sup> O lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.
2: <sup>2</sup> Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.
3: <sup>3</sup> Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
4: <sup>4</sup> For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.
5: <sup>5</sup> Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
6: <sup>6</sup> Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
7: <sup>7</sup> Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
8: <sup>8</sup> If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
9: <sup>9</sup> If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
10: <sup>10</sup> Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
11: <sup>11</sup> If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.
12: <sup>12</sup> Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
13: <sup>13</sup> For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
14: <sup>14</sup> I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
15: <sup>15</sup> My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
16: <sup>16</sup> Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
17: <sup>17</sup> How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
18: <sup>18</sup> If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
19: <sup>19</sup> Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
20: <sup>20</sup> For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
21: <sup>21</sup> Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
22: <sup>22</sup> I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.
23: <sup>23</sup> Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
24: <sup>24</sup> And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
